item.title: 可可产量创下新纪录，北美碾磨量超出预期
item.description: 纽约可可期货创下新纪录，原因是尽管全球供应紧张，价格创下新高，但巧克力工厂的加工速度仍在加快。【原文：Cocoa futures in New York touched a fresh record as the pace of processing in chocolate factories holds up despite a global supply crunch and record prices.】

item.title: 土耳其中央银行行长誓言 "不惜一切代价 "应对通货膨胀
item.description: 据直接知情人士透露，土耳其央行行长法提赫-卡拉汉（Fatih Karahan）承诺将 "不惜一切代价 "抑制通货膨胀，并表示如有必要将进一步收紧银根。【原文：Turkish central bank Governor Fatih Karahan promised to do “whatever it takes” to curb inflation and signaled further monetary tightening if needed, according to people with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 债券 "越久越高"，5%收益率重回视野
item.description: 欢迎收看《每周定调》（Weekly Fix），我们坚信降息会在某时某地到来。我是彭博亚洲市场直播团队负责人加菲尔德-雷诺兹（Garfield Reynolds）。【原文：Welcome to the Weekly Fix, the newsletter that’s confident rate cuts are coming sometime, somewhere. I’m Garfield Reynolds, Bloomberg’s Markets Live team leader in Asia.】

item.title: 德意志银行在亚洲私人银行业务改革中裁员数十人
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）过去一周在亚洲裁减了 10 个私人银行职位，这是继最近几个季度数十次裁员之后的又一次裁员，因为德意志银行将目光投向了利润更高的市场，并剔除了表现不佳的客户。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG trimmed 10 private banking roles in Asia over the past week, adding to dozens of cuts in recent quarters as it zooms in on more profitable markets and weeds out underperformers, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 以色列就报道的伊朗袭击是否发出了足够强烈的信息展开辩论
item.description: 以色列官方对周五报道的袭击伊朗事件保持沉默，以色列的分析师和官员就袭击的规模是强势还是弱势的标志发表了看法。【原文：As Israel maintained official silence on Friday’s reported attack on Iran, its analysts and officials weighed in on whether the scale of the assault was a sign of strength or weakness.】

item.title: 今年上涨 6.4% 后桥水增持中国股票和债券
item.description: 桥水联合基金公司（Bridgewater Associates）的中国在岸对冲基金正在增加对本地股票和债券的投资，此前风险资产的反弹将第一季度的回报率提升至 6.4%，超过了大多数本地竞争对手。【原文：Bridgewater Associates’ onshore China hedge fund is adding exposure to local stocks and bonds after a rally in risk assets boosted returns in the first quarter to 6.4%, beating most local rivals.】

item.title: 美国银行策略师称利率焦虑加剧股票外流
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp.）的策略师表示，由于美国经济强劲、通胀持续高企，加剧了市场对美联储将在更长时间内维持较高利率的担忧，投资者正在将资金撤出股票市场。【原文：Investors are pulling money out of equities as a strong US economy and sticky inflation fuel concerns that the Federal Reserve will keep interest rates higher for longer, according to Bank of America Corp. strategists.】

item.title: 在避险需求的推动下，新兴市场股市将迎来两年来最糟糕的一周
item.description: 由于中东紧张局势升级刺激了投资者的避险需求，黄金和石油价格上涨，新兴市场股市和货币周五走软。【原文：Emerging-market stocks and currencies weakened on Friday as the escalation of tension in the Middle East spurred safe-haven demand among investors, sending gold and oil prices higher.】

item.title: 泰晤士报》称泰晤士河水务公司寻求将账单提高 56
item.description: 据《泰晤士报》报道，泰晤士水务公司正在寻求将用户账单提高 56%，以资助其五年支出计划。【原文：Thames Water is seeking to increase customer bills by 56% to fund its five-year spending plan, according to The Times newspaper.】

item.title: 日本下议院通过儿童保育津贴基金法案
item.description: 日本国会下议院通过了一项法案，增加保险费以帮助为扩大育儿津贴提供资金，这是朝着实现首相岸田文雄的旗舰政策之一迈出的一步。【原文：Japan’s lower house of parliament passed a bill to add insurance premiums to help finance an expansion of childcare allowances, in a step toward realizing one of Prime Minister Fumio Kishida’s flagship policies.】

item.description:
了解即将举行的投票的利害关系。【原文：

Understanding the stakes in the upcoming vote.

item.title: 市场权衡伊朗罢工事件，欧洲天然气市场保持稳定
item.description: 在交易商评估以色列打击伊朗的影响时，欧洲天然气价格趋于稳定。【原文：European natural gas prices steadied as traders evaluate the impact of Israel’s strike on Iran.】

item.title: 越南国家银行十年来首次拍卖黄金
item.description: 越南国家银行将在十多年后恢复金条拍卖，以求在金价屡创新高的情况下增加贵金属供应。【原文：State Bank of Vietnam will resume auctions of gold bars after over a decade as it seeks to boost supply of the precious metal amid record high prices.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行、法国巴黎银行、德意志银行盈利取决于交易和利率
item.description: 在华尔街同行的业绩喜忧参半之后，欧洲最大的银行接过了下周的接力棒。【原文：Europe’s biggest banks pick up the baton next week after mixed results from Wall Street peers.】

item.title: Scicluna 警告称，如果欧洲央行和美联储不减息，欧洲将面临双重打击
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员爱德华-斯奇鲁纳（Edward Scicluna）表示，如果国内和美国不降低利率，欧元区徘徊不前的经济将面临双重打击。【原文：The euro zone’s stuttering economy would face a twin blow should interest rates not be lowered both at home and in the US, according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Edward Scicluna.】

item.title: 货币交易员转向期权市场寻找地缘政治避风港
item.description: 由于担心中东冲突扩大，货币市场全面进入风险厌恶模式，交易者急于在现货和期权中寻找避风港。【原文：Currency markets are in full risk-off mode amid fears of a widening conflict in the Middle East, with traders rushing for safe havens in both spot and options.】

item.title: Man Group 客户第一季度获利 16 亿美元
item.description: 据 Man Group Plc 报告，今年前三个月其基金流出 16 亿美元，是近四年来流出最多的一个季度。该公司股价下跌。【原文：Man Group Plc reported $1.6 billion of outflows from its funds during the first three months of the year, the most in any quarter in almost four years. Its shares fell.】

item.title: 约翰内斯堡交易所计划全面改革以鼓励小型上市
item.description: 约翰内斯堡证券交易所（Johannesburg Stock Exchange）的运营者提议放宽一些上市要求，以鼓励小型公司在该交易所上市，消除一些它认为已成为障碍的繁文缛节。【原文：The operator of the Johannesburg Stock Exchange has proposed easing some listing requirements in a bid to encourage smaller companies to the bourse, removing some of the red tape it says has become an obstacle.】

item.title: 最受欢迎的墨西哥比索受到中东风险上升的冲击
item.description: 墨西哥比索创下四年来最大跌幅，原因是中东冲突加剧削弱了对该货币的需求，而墨西哥比索一直是套利交易最青睐的目标之一。【原文：The Mexican peso slumped the most in four years as increasing conflict in the Middle East sapped demand for the currency that has been one of the favorite targets for carry trades.】

item.title: 欧洲央行卡扎克称现在宣布通胀胜利为时尚早
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员马丁斯-卡扎克斯（Martins Kazaks）说，即使欧洲中央银行有望在 6 月份首次降息，但现在就宣布欧元区通胀已经消失还为时过早。【原文：It’s still too early to declare that euro-area inflation has been vanquished, even if the European Central Bank is on track to deliver a first interest-rate cut in June, Governing Council member Martins Kazaks said.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国市场现在的动向
item.description: 2024 年 1 月 3 日，星期三，英国伦敦金融城，伦敦证券交易所集团公司的标志。1984年1月3日推出的富时100指数是20世纪80年代改变伦敦金融城的众多创新之一。摄影师：Hollie Adams/Bloomberg【原文：The logo of London Stock Exchange Group Plc in the company's office atrium in the City of London, UK, on Wednesday, Jan. 3, 2024. The FTSE 100, launched on Jan. 3, 1984, was one of many innovations that transformed the City of London in the 1980s. Photographer: Hollie Adams/Bloomberg】

item.title: 越南中央银行表示随时准备干预货币市场
item.description: 在越南盾跌至历史新低之际，越南央行表示，"即使在今天，如果需要的话"，也随时准备干预外汇市场。【原文：Vietnam is ready to intervene in the foreign-exchange market “even today, if needed,” the central bank said, as the dong falls to a record low.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行高层称 "快速 "逃离风险的趋势将持续下去
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）的一位高级投资银行家表示，由于担心中东冲突升级，投资者正在迅速撤离风险资产。【原文：A senior Barclays Plc investment banker said investors are rapidly moving away from risk assets due to concerns about an escalation in the Middle East conflict.】

item.title: 为什么英国股市可能正在慢慢消亡？
item.description:
皮尔-亨特（Peel Hunt）研究主管查尔斯-霍尔（Charles Hall）告诉《梅琳谈理财》（Merryn Talks Money），养老基金、财富经理和个人正在以惊人的速度撤出资金。【原文：

Peel Hunt head of research Charles Hall tells Merryn Talks Money that pension funds, wealth managers and individuals are pulling money out at an alarming rate.

】

item.title: 干燥炎热的夏季威胁澳大利亚第一大州的谷物收成
item.description: 据西澳大利亚谷物行业协会称，在澳大利亚第一大产粮州开始播种下一季作物之际，持续干旱、炎热的夏季正在增加该州谷物种植者的担忧。【原文：A lingering dry, hot summer is increasing concerns for grain farmers in Australia’s top producing state as they begin planting the next crop, according to the Grain Industry Association of Western Australia.】

item.title: 澳新银行与澳大利亚养老金协会就印度投资事宜进行谈判
item.description: 据一位银行高级官员透露，澳新银行集团控股有限公司正在与澳大利亚养老基金讨论投资印度基础设施资产及其债务市场的事宜。【原文：ANZ Group Holdings Ltd. is in discussions with Australian pension funds about investing in India’s infrastructure assets and its debt market, according to a senior bank official.】

item.title: 美国敦促中国提高知识产权保护透明度
item.description: 在美国大选年贸易紧张局势迫在眉睫之际，美国商务部官员卡蒂-维达尔（Kathi Vidal）表示，中国政府需要更明确地说明如何保护知识产权，并应对新形式的侵权行为。【原文：Beijing needs to be clearer on how it’s protecting intellectual property and address new forms of infringement, US commerce official Kathi Vidal said as trade tensions loom in an US election year.】

item.title: 中东问题、美联储鹰派令市场情绪低落，亚洲股市暴跌
item.description: 由于对中东紧张局势升级的担忧和对美国利率长期走高的忧虑再度升温，市场普遍出现避险情绪，亚洲股市大幅下挫。【原文：Asian stocks plunged as broad risk aversion swept through markets on renewed concerns over an escalation of tensions in the Middle East and worries about higher-for-longer US rates.】
